meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a ringing metallic sound.
meanings.sent1: The keys jangle loudly in my pocket.
meanings.sent2: The wind chimes jangle in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The jangle of the tambourine added a lively touch to the music.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter jangled like a set of bells.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock jangled me awake every morning.

meanings.sent1: The jangle of pots and pans echoed in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The jangle of the car alarm startled the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The jangle of the out-of-tune piano made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent4: The jangle of the broken bell symbolized chaos in the story.
meanings.sent5: The jangle of the wind against the window was unsettling.
